article.headline: Boise State 79, Idaho 64
article.story: BOISE, Idaho (AP) -- Freshman reserve Coby Karl scored 13 of his 19 points in the second half and Bryan Defares added 16 points to lead Boise State to a 79-64 win over Idaho on Saturday. Karl tied a career high in scoring while going 4-for-6 from 3-point range for Boise State (6-1) while playing only 19 minutes. Reserve forward Jermaine Blackburn added 10 points for BSU, which beat the Vandals 81-69 last week in Moscow. Tyrone Hayes was the only player for Idaho (2-5) to score in double figures with 18. Idaho led 6-0 seven minutes into the game after Boise State missed its first eight field-goal attempts. But the Broncos ran off 10 points in the next three minutes to take a 10-8 lead and stretched the margin to 36-26 as Defares hit a 3-pointer at the end of the half. Trailing 51-37 with 13:39 left in the game, the Vandals made a brief run, narrowing the Bronco lead to 51-44 at 10:32. But Booker Nabors scored seven points over the next three minutes to put BSU ahead comfortably 60-48. Boise State shot 50 percent from the field (28-for-56) despite its early shooting drought. Idaho had difficulty hitting from the field most of the game, shooting only 40 percent (22-for-55). The Vandals converted on only one of seven from three-point range.
